Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model

Class Patron

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model.Patron
public class Patron extends Object
The Patron class represents a patron of the library.

  • Constructor Details

    • Patron

      public Patron(int id, String name, String phoneNumber, String email, boolean isDeleted)
      Constructor initializes the patron with ID, name, and phone number.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the patron.
      name - The name of the patron.
      phoneNumber - The phone number of the patron.
      email - The email of the patron.
      isDeleted - Flag to indicate if the patron is hidden.

    • Patron

      public Patron(int id, String name, String phoneNumber, String email)
      Constructor initializes the patron with ID, name, phone number, and email. The isDeleted flag is set to false by default.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the patron.
      name - The name of the patron.
      phoneNumber - The phone number of the patron.
      email - The email of the patron.

    • borrowBook

      public void borrowBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Add a book to the patron's list of borrowed books.
      Parameters:
      book - The book to be borrowed.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - If the book is null.

    • renewBook

      public void renewBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Renew the borrowing period of a book (not implemented yet).
      Parameters:
      book - The book to renew.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - If the renewal process encounters an error.

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Remove a book from the patron's list of borrowed books.
      Parameters:
      book - The book to be returned.
      Throws:
      LibraryException - If the book is null or not borrowed by the patron.
